alert.note: Alert for Lauderdale; Newton (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Newton and Lauderdale Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 200 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Union to Daleville to near Emelle. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Meridian Station and Daleville around 205 PM CDT. Collinsville, Lauderdale and Duffee around 215 PM CDT. Marion around 220 PM CDT. Toomsuba and Kewanee around 225 PM CDT. Hickory and Zero around 230 PM CDT. Chunky, Alamucha and Meehan around 235 PM CDT. Causeyville around 240 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
